title: Hedge Payments Launches Round-Up Feature to Power Up Betting Wallets
subtitle: New integration allows users to link bank accounts and automatically round up spare change into DraftKings, FanDuel, and more.
author: Hedge Payments Team

contentBlocks.text: Hedge Payments has officially launched its highly anticipated Round-Up feature, enabling users to effortlessly invest spare change from everyday purchases into their favorite gaming and sports betting platforms.

With the Round-Up feature, Hedge users can now link their existing bank accounts — including Chase, Bank of America, and PNC — to automatically round each transaction to the nearest dollar. The spare change is then funneled directly into supported wallets like DraftKings, FanDuel, Caesars, and PrizePicks, giving users a seamless way to grow their gaming balances without lifting a finger.
We're building the bridge between daily spending and daily entertainment. With Round-Ups, every coffee, ride share, or grocery bill becomes a step toward your next jackpot.
contentBlocks.attribution: Jon Marino, Chief Product Officer at Hedge Payments

contentBlocks.text: The integration is secure, fast, and entirely opt-in. Once connected, users can view their round-up history, manage deposit thresholds, and even pause or redirect funds based on promotions across platforms.

A user buys lunch for $9.45. Hedge rounds up $0.55 and transfers it to their DraftKings wallet. Over the course of a month, those small change deposits can total more than $30 in betting credit — all without changing spending habits.

The Round-Up feature is available now to all verified Hedge Payments users through the latest app update. To start rounding up and cashing in, visit [hedgepayments.com/roundup](https://hedgepayments.com/roundup).
